body_html:
As @quaeler pointed even if you set default flags and have all the ones, including `msse4.1`, enabled in your system that you specified whan building I suspect it should've worked if properly defined either way.
…
On Mon, Dec 25, 2017, 3:01 PM loki der quaeler ***@***.***> wrote: Also, there is an errant space in your copt specifying msse4.1 which is probably leading to the Bazel complaints. — You are receiving this because you commented. As @quaeler pointed even if you set default flags and have all the ones, including `msse4.1`, enabled in your system that you specified whan building I suspect it should've worked if properly defined either way.

 Also, there is an errant space in your copt specifying msse4.1 which is
 probably leading to the Bazel complaints.

body:
As @quaeler pointed even if you set default flags and have all the ones, including `msse4.1`, enabled in your system that you specified whan building I suspect it should've worked if properly defined either way.

On Mon, Dec 25, 2017, 3:01 PM loki der quaeler <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Also, there is an errant space in your copt specifying msse4.1 which is
> probably leading to the Bazel complaints.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
